page.title: 04The Castle, Warwick.
page.content: Warwick Castle is one of the most beautiful and best preserved castles in Britain. It rises steeply from the River Avon and its position was of strategic importance from the earliest times. After 375 years of ownership by the Greviille family the castle was sold in 1978 to Madame Tussauds of London and is now open to the public every day. The castle as seen today dates mainly from the 14th century built round Ethelfreda's mound which was built by the Normans around 1068. In1264 the castle was sacked by the army of Simon de Montfort and rebuilt in the 14th century by the Beauchamp family. Special points of interest include the State Rooms, the Great Hall, the Armoury, Dungeon and Torture Chamber, Historic Towers and the Italian Library. 60 acres of park and woodland are also open to visitors.
